DOC.HEAD: NOW Cotton Bowl Parade Will Expose Too Many Legs
DOC.TEXT: The National Organization for Women is kicking up a fuss over plans to lead off the Cotton Bowl Parade with 995 pairs of women's legs. The local chapter is circulating a petition objecting to the use of ``sex appeal and chauvinism'' in promoting the New Year's Day parade, which will begin with members of the National Cheerleaders Association Dance-Drill Team. ``We just want to raise awareness,'' local NOW spokeswoman Karen Ashmore said Monday. ``We have valuable contributions to make to society other than legs.'' Paul Gleiser, executive director of the parade, called the petition drive an overreaction. ``It's a parade,'' he said. ``It goes down the street and little kids sitting on their dad's shoulders get excited.'' ``Do we start eliminating these women from the parade?'' said H. Ward Lay, chairman of the Cotton Bowl Parade Pageantry Committee. ``We just happen to be the parade that has the most beautiful women in it, but we also just happen to be in the city that has the most beautiful women in it, and the state, too.'' ``If they're upset, I'm indeed sorry,'' Lay said. ``But the parade will go on in its form and not be changed.''
